questions.question: What declarative visualization library is based on the Grammar of Graphics?
questions.explanation: Altair provides a declarative API based on Vega and Vega-Lite specifications.

questions.question: What JavaScript library creates custom interactive data visualizations?
questions.explanation: D3.js binds data to DOM elements for flexible visualizations.

questions.question: What technique reduces overplotting by adding random jitter?
questions.explanation: Jittering adds small random noise to separate overlapping points.

questions.question: What visualization shows parallel coordinates for multivariate data?
questions.explanation: Parallel coordinates display high-dimensional data across parallel axes.

questions.question: What method visualizes dimensionality reduction results in 2D?
questions.explanation: t-SNE plots show high-dimensional data clusters in lower dimensions.

questions.question: What chart displays flow between stages in a process?
questions.explanation: Sankey diagrams show flows with proportional widths between nodes.

questions.question: What visualization combines geographic maps with data overlays?
questions.explanation: Choropleth maps use colors to represent data values across regions.

questions.question: What library integrates with geographic data for mapping?
questions.explanation: Folium creates interactive maps using Leaflet.js in Python.

questions.question: What technique handles transparency to show overlapping density?
questions.explanation: Alpha blending uses transparency to reveal overlapping data patterns.

questions.question: What chart shows time-oriented data with range and uncertainty?
questions.explanation: Ribbon charts display confidence intervals or ranges over time.
